contents.title: tradeb0t-core ðŸ¤–
contents.description: Tradebot is the library for creating trading bots for exchanges.

children.value: Tradebot is the library for creating trading bots for exchanges.
for exchanges. It allows to create algorithms for different exchanges without changing them.
- each tradebot instance is isolated from other instances. It allows to run multiple bots on the same machine.
- tradebot have its own API based on
. It allows to quickly create UI for managing bots.
This project is used to be my diploma project, and you can check its orginal repository
. Now I'm trying to make it more useful for other people.
Implement script for running several instances in multiple processes
Domain includes types of entities in the integrated exchange.
. But it is not recommended, as these types will be helpful in process of creating other modules.
is layer between exchange and tradebot internal logic.
It also includes two submodules for splitting logic:
- send requests to place orders to exchange;
- for translation exchange types to tradebot types.
Note, that you can provide object containing API methods to exchange (
in example). It will be available in
to make it possible for tradebot to understand types of your exchange.
Internal domain of tradebot is provided by
Note, that you can extract specific domains types from

props.code:
import {AbstractInfoModule} from 'tradeb0t-core'
import type API from '@exchange/sdk'

import {Domain} from '../Domain'

export class InfoModule extends AbstractInfoModule<Domain, API>{/*...*/}

import {AbstractTradeModule} from 'tradeb0t-core'
import type API from '@exchange/sdk'

import {Domain} from '../Domain'

export class TradeModule extends AbstractTradeModule<Domain, API>{/*...*/}

contents.title: Architecture
contents.description: The whole tradeb0t project is divided into several layers:

children.value: The whole tradeb0t project is divided into several layers:
- the main layer, which is responsible for the bot's logic and the interaction with the user.
- the layer responsible for the trade algorithms. It only provides interfaces, you should implement them in your own project.
- the layer responsible for the interaction with the exchange. It only provides abstract classes, you should implement them in your own project.
- the layer responsible for the data storage. Data is partially stored in memory, partially in the SQLite database file.
- the layer responsible for the data model. It also provides utils for mapping data from the exchange to the tradeb0t domain.

contents.title: Domain model
contents.description: Tradeb0t operates with specific domain model in order to provide a unified way to work with different exchanges and assets.

children.value: Tradeb0t operates with specific domain model in order to provide a unified way to work with different exchanges and assets.
Tradeb0t stores information only about one account, because it is designed to be used by one person.
Information about assets is stored in the memory, because this information required only if it is fresh. Also, application does not use disk resources to write and read this information.
Information about algorithms is persistanly stored in the SQLite file, because it should be available between sessions.

contents.title: Overview
contents.description: Tradeb0t provides abstract classes for trading algorithms. It is designed to make it possible to reuse the same code for different exchanges.

children.value: Tradeb0t provides abstract classes for trading algorithms. It is designed to make it possible to reuse the same code for different exchanges.
You just need to implement 3 main methods:
- main method of the algorithm. It is called every time when the algorithm is executed.
- method that is called when the algorithm is resumed after the pause.
- method that is called in order to stop the algorithm.
class also provides the following methods for saving specific state of the algorithm to storage:
- saves the state of the algorithm before the
- saves the state of the algorithm after it is resumed.
- saves the state of the algorithm after it is successfully finished.
- saves the state of the algorithm after error occured.

contents.description: Slicing is a simple algorithm, which split one large order into smaller ones and place them during some time. You can see example code below.
